media:group.media:description:
๐ีีธึีฝีกีฝีฟีกีถีจ ีชีกีดีกีถีกีฏีกีพีธึีกีบีฅีฝ ีกึีฃีฅีฌีฅีฌ ีง ีฐีกึีกีฐีกีฟีซีฏีกีตีซีถ ีดีทีกีฏีกีขีธึีตีฝีฅึีซ ีกึีฟีกีฐีกีถีธึีดีจ ิติฑีี ีฅึีฏึีถีฅึึ ๐ิฟีกึีณีกีชีกีดีฏีฅีฟ ีฐีฅีผีกีถีฏีกึีธึีด ีผีธึีฝ-ีธึีฏึีกีซีถีกีฏีกีถ ีฐีกีฏีกีดีกึีฟีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีคีซีพีกีถีกีฃีซีฟีกีฏีกีถ ีฌีธึีฎีธึีด ีึีกีถีฝีซีกีตีซ ีถีกีญีกีฃีกีฐ ิทีดีกีถีธึีฅีฌ ีีกีฏึีธีถีจ ีนีซ ีฟีฅีฝีถีธึีดึ ๐ีีธึีฝีกีฝีฟีกีถีซ ีถีกีญีกีฃีกีฐีซ ีญีธีฝีถีกีฏ ิดีดีซีฟึีซ ีีฅีฝีฏีธีพีจ ีดีกีถึีกีดีกีฝีถีฅีฌ ีง, ีฉีฅ ีธึ ีคีฅีบึีธึีด ีีธึีฝีกีฝีฟีกีถีจ ีกีถีดีซีปีกีบีฅีฝ ีฏีคีกีคีกึีฅึีถีซ ีึีฏึีกีซีถีกีตีธึีด ีฐีกีฟีธึีฏ ีฃีธึีฎีธีฒีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจึ ๐ิตี ีบีกีฟีชีกีดีซีปีธึีถีฅึีจ ีฏีทึีปีกีถึีฅีถ ีผีธึีฝีกีฏีกีถ ีฃีกีฆีถ ีธึ ีถีกีพีฉีจึ ๐ิฑึึีดีฟีตีกีถ ีฅึีฏึีถีฅึีซ ีผีกีฆีดีกีฏีกีถ ีฃีฅึีกีฟีฅีฝีนีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีธึีด ีฏีกึีฎีธึีด ีฅีถ, ีธึ ีกีผีกีปีซีฏีก ึ ึีฅึีซีถ ีผีธึีฝีกีฏีกีถ ีธึีชีฅึีจ ีฏีฐีกึีฑีกีฏีพีฅีถ ิฟีซึีซ ีพึีกึ

CivilNet host and analyst Eric Hacopian discusses the larger context of the Russian invasion of Ukraine, as well as how Armenia fits into it. Eric also talks about the recent tensions in Nagorno-Karabakh and the motives of Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev.

entry.title: A New Wave of Violence in Karabakh

media:group.media:title: A New Wave of Violence in Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
Despite a recent lull in tensions, the situation in Nagorno-Karabakh is tense once again. Azerbaijani forces have been firing at Armenian villages using mortars and grenade launchers, and the entire gas supply to Nagorno-Karabakh has been cut by Azerbaijan. So, why is Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev so intent on continuing these policies despite consistently maintaining that the conflict is over?

entry.title: Stories of torture and silent crimes in Azerbaijan

media:group.media:title: Stories of torture and silent crimes in Azerbaijan
media:group.media:description:
In her book Sadistic Pleasures, Silent Crimes of Azerbaijan, freelance journalist Ashkhen Arakelyan writes in details about the psychological and physical torture inflicted on Armenian captives in Azerbaijan.
For months, Arakelyan met with 14 prisoners of war, soldiers, civilians, women and men, young and old, who told her the stories of their captivity in Azerbaijani prisons before, during and after the 2020 Karabakh War.
